definition: acceptable/passable/justifiable/(of a course of action) to make sense
to persuade
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
variant of 說|说[shuo1]
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
surname Guo
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
(experienced action marker)

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)

sentences.english: I don't think there will ever be any problem about canonizing you.
sentences.chinese: 我认为，倘若把你封为使徒也说得过去。

sentences.english: Reviewing what actually took place this weekend, none of these explanations wears very well, except as indicators of their expositors’ ideological blinders.
sentences.chinese: 回顾周末发生的事情，这些解释没有一个很说得过去。

sentences.english: He gave some reasons, only a few of which were valid.
sentences.chinese: 他给了一些理由，只有几个说得过去。

sentences.english: I mean, I'd understand it if they were shagging .
sentences.chinese: 我意思是，要是他们搞在一起了还说得过去。

sentences.english: Calling 2017 the Year of the Chicken would also work.
sentences.chinese: 同理，说鸡年的“鸡”是母鸡也说得过去。
她的英语发音还说得过去。

definition: lit. can pass through (an opening)/fig. can get by (in life)/tolerably well/not too bad/How are you getting by?/How's life?
cannot be justified/inexcusable
reasonable and fair (idiom)
good and bad/most unfortunate occurrence/in any case/whatever
see 未可厚非[wei4 ke3 hou4 fei1]
pardonable (of interruption, misunderstanding etc)
to achieve with difficulty/only just up to the task/barely adequate
not bad/OK
to not lack
careless/casual/vague/not so bad/so-so/tolerable/fair
to do with difficulty/to force sb to do sth/reluctant/barely enough
easy to deal with/not a problem/(polite answer) you flatter me
not up to much/very indifferent/nothing great about it/nothing good to be said about it
to be honest, ...
moreover/besides/in addition/furthermore
far-fetched/implausible (chain of reasoning)
(coll.) not bad/good/fine
